DOC.HEADLINE: HISTORIC OAK FELLED BY WIND IN MARYLAND
DOC.TEXT: It survived the Battle of Bladensburg and the Civil War , but a wind and rain storm toppled the venerable Lincoln Oak from its hillside perch . The tree , believed to have sprouted around 1510 , stood more_than a_hundred feet tall in Ft . Lincoln Cemetery in Maryland , bordering Washington . It received its name after Abraham_Lincoln reviewed his troops during the Civil War from the shade of its spreading branches .
